channel.title: Runescape on Wikipedia
channel.description:
Instead of vandalizing Wikipedia like so many do, I decided to try to add some informative information, hopefully it will stay there and not be reverted, if you have anything else intelligent to add please do so, but dont do obnoxious things and get the whole section removed ;) :D this is what I added to [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Runescape]Runescape[/url]:
==Autoing== There are currently many safe, effective ways of "Autoing" in ''RuneScape'': ===SCAR=== SCAR stands for "Shite Compared to AutoRune." You can still download SCAR from the creator's website www.dylock.net/scar/ the programmer that made SCAR is known by his nickname of kaitnieks. SCAR is basically a scriptable color clicker, but it has very very advanced features, and actually moves your mouse and simulates keyboard clicks, with the right script written by a skilled scripter it can be 100% undetectable. It works not only on runescape, but on many many things, and it works directly on the client in the runescape webbrowser. You can get SCAR scripts at cheating forums such as www.moparisthebest.com/smf/ and www.villavu.com/forums/ ===Aryan=== Aryan is a JAVA bot written for runescape by a team of devs from kaitneiks.com, the team is headed by the primary writer of the bot RegeX. This method is currently still very detectable, but you can run multiple instances of it on one computer, hence having many characters auto supplies at the same time, then trade the goods off to another character, making a lot of money. This method also requires weekly updates as runescape updates, but has an autoupdater program written for this purpose. This bot can be obtained from either impsoft.com or usually the moparisthebest forums at www.moparisthebest.com/smf/.

I know this is old, but posting anyways.

Awww…
My SCAR Kaitnieks got removed too.
Shouldnt we try and get protection from wikipedia?
I mean, seriously, too many runescape lovers who keep refreshing, tensed up, ready to click edit, and I bet there is a guy at jagex who does it too.

im sure if we tell wikipedia, then we can get protection fom deletion.

Graphics
JAGEX calles the graphics 3d, but actually the're ugly as your moms ass.
In good servers (private ones, you can make one at moparisthebest.com) you can use the ::emote # code.

[br][size=1]Posted at: April 08, 2006, 01:42:06 pm[/size][hr]

===Materials=== *Dragon (U gotta pay for that sh@t. JAGEX just wants your money for that red pix! Just go to a server on moparisthebest.com and you can use it 4 free!
[br][size=1]Posted at: April 08, 2006, 01:43:59 pm[/size][hr]
Please refrain from adding nonsense to Wikipedia, as you did to Runescape. It is considered vandalism. If you would like to experiment, use the sandbox. -- gtdp (T)/(C) 20:45, 8 April 2006 (UTC)

O my god The're saw what 20 seconds after i posted it!

Read full topic

item.title: Runescape on Wikipedia
item.dc:creator: @Arkanor Arkanor
item.description:
@Arkanor wrote:

Bebemycat2:

en.wikipedia.org

RuneScape

RuneScape is a fantasy massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG) developed and published by Jagex, released originally in January 2001. RuneScape can be used as a graphical browser game implemented on the client-side in Java, and incorporates 3D rendering. Although since the release of the NXT client in April 2016, a non-browser based version of the game that is written in C++ is also available. The game has had over 200 million accounts created and is recognised by the Guinness Wor...


I added it again, I took out the links to forums though, that way people shouldn't have to much of a problem with it anf keep it there.

They removed it. Probably a Jagex-worshipper is to blame. You know, the kind of person who thinks that Jagex is the greatest, Runescape is the best game of all time, and everyone who cheats "suicks azz lol".

Read full topic

@KyleGut3 wrote:

Accessed by pressing Alt-F4 (which has been recently changed to ctrl-w) while playing the game, this control panel will allow cheaters to turn off random events, make objects and monsters monochromatic, and open special communication channels for easily obtaining information such as location coordinates, inventory, stats, other players around, et cetera

Thats some sweet cheating right there, Krichevskoy XP

item.dc:creator: @arraness14 arraness14
item.description:
@arraness14 wrote:

moparisthebest:

Instead of vandalizing Wikipedia like so many do, I decided to try to add some informative information, hopefully it will stay there and not be reverted, if you have anything else intelligent to add please do so, but dont do obnoxious things and get the whole section removed

this is what I added to Runescape:

[quote]==Autoing==
There are currently many safe, effective ways of "Autoing" in ''RuneScape'':

===SCAR===
SCAR stands for "Shite Compared to AutoRune." You can still download SCAR from the creator's website www.dylock.net/scar/ the programmer that made SCAR is known by his nickname of kaitnieks. SCAR is basically a scriptable color clicker, but it has very very advanced features, and actually moves your mouse and simulates keyboard clicks, with the right script written by a skilled scripter it can be 100% undetectable. It works not only on runescape, but on many many things, and it works directly on the client in the runescape webbrowser. You can get SCAR scripts at cheating forums such as www.moparisthebest.com/smf/ and www.villavu.com/forums/

===Aryan===
Aryan is a JAVA bot written for runescape by a team of devs from kaitneiks.com, the team is headed by the primary writer of the bot RegeX. This method is currently still very detectable, but you can run multiple instances of it on one computer, hence having many characters auto supplies at the same time, then trade the goods off to another character, making a lot of money. This method also requires weekly updates as runescape updates, but has an autoupdater program written for this purpose. This bot can be obtained from either impsoft.com or usually the moparisthebest forums at www.moparisthebest.com/smf/.[/quote]

Great That would get us some fame.

Read full topic
